properties.detail: Cuyahoga Valley requested a commercial services analysis and strategy to aid the park in examining how commercial services could diversify recreation opportunities and make better use of the existing facilities to serve the visiting public. Consultants will suggest potential program improvements as well as recommendations for expansion and new services.

Fire Island National Seashore requested BPI assistance in developing a strategic approach to managing its leasing program. The project will design formal processes and establish appropriate capacity to allow for potential expansion of the program to include several other high-potential locations.

Harpers Ferry Center is currently defining a new mid-term strategic vision and requested BPI support to provide an innovative organizational design that will standardize project intake, prioritization, and management.  The project will help simplify project management processes, remove barriers to collaboration, support efficient project planning and budgeting at the park level, and help project managers balance workloads.

properties.type: Special Use Permit Improvement & Land Lease Evaluation
properties.detail: Appalachian National Scenic Trail requested a Special Use Permit strategy to guide the park's special use permit projgram, which includes special event, agricultural, construction, and right-of-way permits. The project will streamline the permit inquiry process, better filter and prioritize requests, and share information and policies amongst its partners.

Buffalo National Scenic River has requested BPI assistance with a developing a comprehensive facilities investment strategy. This project will provide an assessment of the park's visitor services, operations, and asset investment. The evaluation will include analysis of facility utilization, current condition, projected facility needs, resource impacts, and recommendations for overall investment strategies over the next 10 years.

Golden Gate National Recreation Area is studying options to improve transportation to and within the parklands around the Golden Gate Bridge. BPI consultatns will develop a business model and approach for a cooperative management agreement and shuttle transportation system, including transportation data analysis, financial modeling of pricing structures and cost-sharing options, developing performance metrics, and implementation strategies.

Redwood National and State Parks has requested BPI consultants assist them by facilitating a transparent, parkwide workforce and budget planning process in order to regain some financial flexibility. The project will focus on the NPS workforce, but will account for critical contributions from its State and non-profit partners. Consultants will bring a criticial external perspective to provide the park a road map for how to achieve the workforce they need to carry out critical functions and achieve their mission.

Mount Rainier is seeking assistance from BPI to understand how to manage projects with minimal strain on continuing operations, especially during the summer season. Theproject will help the park manage multiple projects from various fund sources while continuing operations (e.g. administrative support, planning and compliance, project management support, or park housing), and will augment their their project prioritization, planning, and development process.
